titleStmt.title: Apollo to the Dean;──── by Dean Swift.

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Right trusty & so forth, We let you to know,
We are very ill us'd by you mortals below;
For first, I have often by chymists been told,
Tho' I know nothing on't, t'is I that make Gold;
Which when you have got, you So carefully hide it,
That since I was born, I hardly have Spy'd it;
Then it must be allow'd when ever I shine,
I forward the grass, and ripen the vine;
To me the good fellows apply for releif,
Without whom they cou'd neither get claret, nor beef;
Yet their wine and their victuals, those curmudgon lubbers,
Lock up from my sight, in Pantrys & cup-boards;
That I have an ill eye, they wickedly think,
And taint all their meat, & sower their drink;
But thirdly & lastly it must be allow'd,
I alone can inspire the Poetical Crowd;
This is gratefully own'd by each boy in the Colledge,
Whom if I inspire, t'is not to my knowledge;
This ev'ry pretender to Rhyme will admit,
Without troubling his head about judgment or wit;
These Gentlemen use me, with kindness & freedom,
And as for their works,── when I please I may read'em;
They ly open on purpose, on counters & stalls,
And the titles I view, when I shine on the walls;
But a Comrade of your's, that traitor Delany,
Whom I for your sake, have us'd better than any;
And of my meer motion, & special good grace,
Intended in time to Succeed to your place;
On tuesday the ninth seditiously came,
With a certain false traitress, one Stella by name;
To the Deanry house, & on the North glass,
Where for fear of the cold, I never can pass;
Then & there, vi et armis, with a certain utensil,
Of value 5 shillings, in English a pencil;
Did maliciously, falsely, & traiterously write,
Whilst Stella aforesaid stood by with a light;
My Sister has lately depos'd upon oath,
That she stop'd in her course to look on 'em both;
That Stella was helping, abetting & aiding,
And still as he writ, stood smiling and reading;
That her eyes were as bright as my self at noon day,
But her graceful black locks were mingled with grey;
And by the description I certainly know,
T'is the Nymph whom I courted some ten years agoe;
Whom when I with the best of my talents endued,
on her promise of yielding; she acted the Prude;
That some verses were writ with felonious intent,
Direct to the north where I never went;
That the letters appear'd revers'd on the Pane,
But in Stella's bright eyes were plac'd right again;
Wherein she distinctly cou'd read ev'ry line,
And presently guess'd the fancy was mine;
She can swear to the person, whom oft she has seen,
At night between cavan-street & colledge green;
Now you see why his verses so seldom are shewn,
The reason is plain they're none of his own;
And observe while you live, that no man is shy,
To discover the Goods he came honestly by;
If I light on a thought he will certainly steal it,
And when he has got it, finds ways to conceal it;
of all the fine things he keeps in the dark,
There's Scarce one in ten, but what has my mark;
An let 'em be seen by the world if he dare,
I'll make it appear they're all stolen ware;
But as for the Poem he writ on the Sash,
I think I have now got him under my lash;
My sister transcrib'd it last night to his Sorrow,
And the publick shall see it, if I live till to morrow;
Thro' the Zodiack around it shall quickly be spread,
In all parts of the globe, where your language is read;
He knows very well I ne're gave a refusal,
When he ask'd for my aid, in the forms that are usual,
But the Secret is this, I did lately intend
To write a few verses on you as my friend;
I study'd a fortnight, before I cou'd find,
As I rode in my chariot, a thought to my mind;
And resolv'd the next winter, for that is my time,
When the days are at shortest, to put it in Rhyme;
Till then it was lock'd in my box at Parnassus;
When your subtle Companion, in hopes to surpass us,
Conveys out my paper of hints by a trick.
For I think in my conscience, he deals with old Nick,
And from my own stock provided with topicks,
He gets to a window beyond both the tropicks;
There out of my sight, just against the north zone,
Writes down my conceits, & calls 'em his own;
And you like a booby the bubble can swallow,
Now who but Delany can write like Apollo;
High-treason by statute!── but here you object,
He only stole hints, the verse is correct;
Tho' the thoughts be Apollo's, t'is finely express'd,
So a thief steals my horse, & gets him well dress'd
Now whereas the sḍ criminal seems past repentance,
We Phœbus think fitt to proceed to his sentence;
Since Delany has dar'd like Prometheus his Sire,
To climb to our region, & there to steal fire;
We order a vulture, in shape of the Spleen,
To prey on his liver, but not to be seen;
And we order our Subjects of ev'ry degree,
To beleive all his verses were written by me;
And under the pain of our highest displeasure,
To call nothing his but the Rhyme & the measure
And lastly for Stella, just out of her prime,
I am too much reveng'd already by time;
In return to her scorn, I send her diseases,
And will now be her friend, when-ever She pleases;
And the gifts I bestow'd her, will find her a lover,
Tho' she lives till she's grey as a badger all over.
